pullrequest.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> gazebo7

content.raw:
I just saw a new flaky failure ([full details here](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/0851378b520e92c9ea0759028abac5c0)):

The `WorldRemoveTest.RemoveBlankWorld/0` test called `physics::remove_worlds()` at
[world_remove.cc:138](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a364ad2dd38cf7cc3/test/integration/world_remove.cc?at=worldless_7#world_remove.cc-138)
but then seg-faulted as a consequence of calling `transport::getAdvertisedTopics()` at
[world_remove.cc:141](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a364ad2dd38cf7cc3/test/integration/world_remove.cc?at=worldless_7#world_remove.cc-141)
immediately after.
The seg-fault came from `ConnectionManager::GetAllPublishers` at
[ConnectionManager.cc:551](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a364ad2dd38cf7cc3/gazebo/transport/ConnectionManager.cc?at=worldless_7#world_remove.cc-551).
The `ConnectionManager` thread is currently in a timed wait at
[ConnectionManager.cc:316](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/a364ad2dd38cf7cc3/gazebo/transport/ConnectionManager.cc?at=worldless_7#world_remove.cc-316).

I'm not sure what happened here.
content.html:
I just saw a new flaky failure (full details here):

The WorldRemoveTest.RemoveBlankWorld/0 test called physics::remove_worlds() at world_remove.cc:138 but then seg-faulted as a consequence of calling transport::getAdvertisedTopics() at world_remove.cc:141 immediately after. The seg-fault came from ConnectionManager::GetAllPublishers at ConnectionManager.cc:551. The ConnectionManager thread is currently in a timed wait at ConnectionManager.cc:316.

I'm not sure what happened here.
